item.title: Special Issue "Deep Learning for Computer-Aided Diagnosis in Biomedical Imaging"
item.description:
I’m serving as a Guest Editor for the Special Issue of Diagnostics titled “Deep Learning for Computer-Aided Diagnosis in Biomedical Imaging”

We will consider papers focused on deep learning applications for automated classification, localization, retrieval, and segmentation of molecules, cells, lesions, nodules, tumors, organs and other structures of interest from biomedical images. Specifically, I’m very interested in research that addresses challenges in deep learning applications, such as learning from small, imbalanced, and noisy data, estimating model uncertainty, evaluating and interpreting models, limiting computing requirements, and designing and building interfaces between algorithms and clinicians. All papers will be published as Open Access.

Submission deadline: 31 March 2021

Contact me to receive a discount on APCs.

item.title: New preprint "Valproic Acid-Induced Changes of 4D Nuclear Morphology in Astrocyte Cells"
item.description:
Our new preprint “Valproic Acid-Induced Changes of 4D Nuclear Morphology in Astrocyte Cells” is now available on bioRxiv.

See my Twittorial for a quick overview.

item.title: New CVPRW'20 paper "Deep Learning for Automatic Pneumonia Detection"
item.description: Our new paper with Tatiana Gabruseva and Dmytro Poplavskiy “Deep Learning for Automatic Pneumonia Detection” is now available in CVPR 2020 Workshop proceedings.

item.title: New book chapter "Medical Image Segmentation Using Deep Neural Networks with Pre-trained Encoders"
item.description: Our new book chapter with Vladimir I. Iglovikov, Alexander Rakhlin and Alexey A. Shvets “Medical Image Segmentation Using Deep Neural Networks with Pre-trained Encoders” is now available at SpringerLink.

item.title: New paper "Albumentations: Fast and Flexible Image Augmentations"
item.description:
Our new paper with Alexander Buslaev, Vladimir I Iglovikov, Eugene Khvedchenya, Alex Parinov and Mikhail Druzhinin “Albumentations: Fast and Flexible Image Augmentations” is now available at Information.

Also check out Albumentations library!
